isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - ROCKER ARM ASSEMBLY, CAMSHAFT, TAPPETS AND PUSH RODS - ROCKER ARM ASSEMBLY - INSPECTION

step1.para: Visually inspect the rocker arm shaft and rocker arm bushings for scoring or signs of excessive wear. If visibly damaged, replace the shaft and/or rocker arm, as required.

note.para: Current production and service rocker arms have an oil spreader groove on the bushing. The oil spreader groove 0.279 mm - 0.457 mm (0.011 in. - 0.018 in. depth), located opposite the oil hole, aids in oil dispersion over the entire bushing surface. Use only late style rocker arms on engines equipped with roller tappets. Refer to Figure 5.6.

figure.caption: Figure 5.4 Remove Retaining Ring from Shaft.
Figure 5.5 Remove Components from Rocker Arm Shaft.

step1.para:
Measure rocker arm bushings using a telescoping gauge and outside micrometer as shown in Figure 5.7
. Measure the bushings at two locations and record the readings.

If the rocker arms are within specifications, they may be reused. Prior to assembly, assure the oil hole in the rocker arms and bushings is open by running a wire through the oil hole. Remove any blockage before reassembly. Refer to Figure 5.8
.

Inspect all rocker arm shaft bracket orifices for blockage. Run a wire through each to assure they are open. Refer to Figure 5.9
.
Inspect the rocker arm shaft springs as follows:

step2.para: Visually inspect for rust, pitting and cracks. Replace as required.

Measure the spring tension using the spring tester SE-2241. Refer to Figure 5.10
and "SPECIFICATIONS".
Apply correct test load and measure test length.

step1.para: Replace springs which do not meet the "SPECIFICATIONS".
